column1: The Pit Room////That was the best barbecue I've ever had.  I'm not from any place that would qualify me to judge barbecue
column2: but it was dynamite.  Brisket was not too fatty
column4: and not tough.  I also had the pork ribs
column5: who's were as good as any pork ribs I've ever had.  Both had the perfect amount of smoke.  I had beans for the side
column6: and they were the best damn pinto beans I imagine could be made in the world.
